result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua P OKeefe

records.addlTxt:
[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 9:08am.
Defendant Joshua P OKeefe in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews right to counsel with Mr. OKeefe. The Court finds Mr. OKeefe competent to represent himself, and that he has knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his right to counsel.

Deputy J Gonzalez -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Mr. OKeefe
Arguments given.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. OKeefe committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
Mr. OKeefe requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date.
The Court informs the parties of the judicial rotation that will occur at the end of the year, and that there will be the right to substitution of the judge. 
After Mr. OKeefe indicates he is demanding a speedy trial as is his right, the Court explains that such a demand cannot be made until arraignment.  Mr. OKeefe then indicates he would like to proceed to arraignment today. 
ADA Teuber indicates that the State is not prepared to file the Information today. 
recess 9:40am 

NEXT:  Arraignment on November 18th at 10:00am
Defendant's Self-Colloquy Re Self-Representation at Preliminary Hearing
Defendant's Courtesy Notices to Assist Judicial Economy
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] case called 11:35 AM Defendant Joshua P OKeefe appeared by phone. ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and updates address.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $7,500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at 189 Village Line Road in Sullivan, Wisconsin
--Defendant is to sign bond no later than 4:00 pm on 9/23/22

The Court allows Defendant to make arrangements with his local Sheriff's Dept for bond administration, Defendant will need to provide the COC with the fax number. If he is unable to make arrangements he will need to come to Jefferson COC to sign bond

recess 11:42 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing 10/21/22 at 9:00 am

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua P OKeefe
Current: 401 N East St, Weyauwega, WI 54983 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2022)
Prior: 3903 Robert St., Stevens Point, WI 54481
Commissioner Weber- "The Court will allow you to appear by phone. The Court will initiate the call @ the appointed time (w/in 10-15 min)."
